cameras.name: DSLR
cameras.description: Digital Single-Lens Reflex cameras use a mirror mechanism to provide an optical viewfinder. Known for their versatility and image quality.

cameras.name: Mirrorless
cameras.description: These cameras lack the mirror mechanism of DSLRs, making them lighter and more compact, while still offering high image quality.

cameras.name: Medium Format
cameras.description: Larger than full-frame sensors, these cameras provide higher resolution and better detail, ideal for professional studio work.

cameras.name: Point-and-Shoot
cameras.description: Compact and user-friendly, these cameras are designed for casual photography with automatic settings.

cameras.name: Film Camera
cameras.description: Traditional analog cameras using film rolls. Valued for their unique aesthetic and high dynamic range.

lenses.name: Prime Lens
lenses.description: Fixed focal length lens known for its sharpness and wide apertures, ideal for low light conditions and depth of field control.

lenses.name: Zoom Lens
lenses.description: Offers a range of focal lengths in one lens, providing flexibility for various shooting scenarios.

lenses.name: Telephoto Lens
lenses.description: Long focal length lens ideal for sports and wildlife photography, allowing for close-up shots from a distance.

lenses.name: Wide-Angle Lens
lenses.description: Short focal length lens that captures a wider field of view, great for landscapes and architectural photography.

lenses.name: Macro Lens
lenses.description: Designed for extreme close-up photography, capturing fine details with a high magnification ratio.

lenses.name: Fish-Eye Lens
lenses.description: An ultra wide-angle lens that produces a highly distorted, spherical view of the world, often used for artistic effect.
